comment: Had her for a grad class. Grades were arbitrary, she taught online class from the YMCA a couple times, doesn't understand how to use D2L (to our detriment), and was incredibly patronizing/demeaning to students. Started semester w/o a syllabus. Assignment rubrics hard to understand. Hard to reach outside of class. Avoid!

I need you to understand that it is impossible to accurately describe this professor in 350 characters. I should have waited another year for another professor to offer the course than take it from her. The academic gods were laughing when they gave her tenure. I submitted an appeal and letters of disgust to the Dean. Fever dream of a class. Flee.

Pleas listen to the reviews!! This is the worst professor I have had  at Kennesaw. She spends most of class time listing off her achievements and moral standings, instead of teaching any course material. There are basically four grades all semester, none have rubrics. She'll try and grade based on participation but won't bother to learn your name.
Please just don't. This is the most delusional professor I have ever had. Don't even bother.

RUN

Don't take a class with this professor unless you want your grades to be put in last minute, no communication, and confusing due dates that change whenever she feels like it! She shouldn't be teaching an online course with her lack of organization and lack of understanding of D2L. She also randomly disappears for weeks with no word from her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: AVOID THIS PROFESSOR. I have had a lot of great professors at KSU but Satchel is not one of them. She does not communicate, doesn't know to properly use D2L, based the entire course solely on her text book and is disrespectful when you don't agree with her. It took months to get our first grade and she gives minimal feedback. AVOID!!!!

Professor Satchel does not dedicate enough time and effort to offer a satisfactory learning experience for her students. I am almost done taking her MENT 4436 course and I can confidently say I barely learned anything in this course. She doesn't grade anything on time, rarely responds to emails, and based most content on her own textbook.

I almost dropped her class. She will take a week to respond to your emails, or not respond to them at all. She grades harsh and the class is very confusing. If you are sick and have to make up something she will not allow it even with a DR. note.  She does not know to use D2L very well, and has no power points or anything uploaded.

Lectures are just recorded of her talking in random places. No powerpoints/slides. Anything like that. Had an emergency that ended up with me in the hospital and asked for an extension on a discussion post. Email was sent with a followup email, and never responded nor acknowledged the email. I accepted that I wouldn't get any credit for it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: The course was incredibly confusing and poorly organized from start to finish, which lead to lots of class confusion. Her lack of knowledge of the D2L system really hurt the class, probably my worse experience since coming to KSU.

Ridiculous amounts of work that we have no class time for, made us learn many unnecessary legal terms since she has a law degree, the entire last month was only guest speakers even though we had a final project and paper due, unclear instructions, just so much unnecessary work. She was complained about to the department head many times.

I had a very hard time in this class due to her lack in knowledge of how to use technology. Many students dropped out throughout the semester due to her lack of communication. She did get better after many complaints. She tried her best to help improve our grades but I was still very stressed just because of the management and lack of organization.
